{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3495635,"name":"James","username":"JamerGamer789","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-29T15:36:01.326Z","cooked":"

I’m new to using the Spark MAX PID controller in the first place, but I am more confused with the latest 2025 configurations and I want to make sure I am doing this right. We are using a REV Through Bore Encoder attached to the absolute encoder board on top of the Spark MAX. We are also using a NEO.

The pivot motor moves when the command, but does not move the setpoint I give it (almost like it is moving to zero, even though the Through Bore encoder is returning values). I assign this setpoint in robot container, where I use a method called by an instant command to assign the new value to the pid controller.

I made an enum table to easily pass values into the PID controller. I’m not sure if that is the issue, something is wrong with my config, or if I lack an understanding of the PID controller. Any help would be appreciated

Subsystem code: 2025-Reefscape-Competition/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/CoralSubsystem.java at Coral-intake-and-pivot · FRC3546/2025-Reefscape-Competition · GitHub
Robot container: 2025-Reefscape-Competition/src/main/java/frc/robot/RobotContainer.java at Coral-intake-and-pivot · FRC3546/2025-Reefscape-Competition · GitHub

As a follow up, how do I cancel the action of the PID controller? Do I always have to give it a set point or can I just tell the Spark MAX to stop?
